briefTitle: Acetaminophen Before Vaccines for Infants Study (AVIS)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Child is a current Group Health enrollee.
2. Child will be seen at a Group Health clinic for a Well Child visit that is expected to include 2 or more vaccines after 6 wks and before 10 months of age.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. If child was born at less than 36 weeks of gestation, the child is not eligible until 4 months of age or older.
2. If the child's birth weight was less than 5.5 pounds (2500 grams), the child is not eligible until 4 months of age or older.

outcomeMeasures.title: Fever >=38C Within 32 Hours of Vaccination.
outcomeMeasures.description: Fever, defined as rectal temperature \>=38C within 32 hours of vaccination.

outcomeMeasures.title: Fever >=39C Within 32 Hours of Vaccination.
outcomeMeasures.description: Fever, defined as rectal temperature \>=39C within 32 hours of vaccination.

outcomeMeasures.title: Study Assignment Unblinded
outcomeMeasures.description: The need for unblinding at any time during the study

outcomeMeasures.title: Medical Utilization
outcomeMeasures.description: Telephone calls to the consulting nurse or the child's physician that were made due to concerns regarding an acute illness, fever, or possible vaccine reaction and outpatient, urgent care, and emergency room visits that were for evaluation of an acute illness, fever, or a possible vaccine reaction, within 32 hours of vaccination.

outcomeMeasures.title: Infant Fussiness
outcomeMeasures.description: Parents were asked to record level of fussiness (compared with the child's usual) within 32 hours of vaccination, using the categories much less than usual, less than usual, about usual, more than usual, and much more than usual.

outcomeMeasures.title: Parent Time Lost From Sleep
outcomeMeasures.description: Parents were asked about their sleep on the night following the vaccinations. They were asked to report whether they slept much less than usual, less than usual, about the usual amount, more than usual, or much more than usual on that night.

outcomeMeasures.title: Infant Time Lost From Sleep
outcomeMeasures.description: Parents were asked about their infant's sleep on the night following the vaccinations. They were asked to report whether their infant slept much less than usual, less than usual, about the usual amount, more than usual, or much more than usual on that night.

outcomeMeasures.title: Parent Time Lost From Work
outcomeMeasures.description: Parents were asked to report whether they were scheduled to work on the day of the vaccination visit (but following that visit) or the next day and, if so, whether they had to miss work to care for their infant because of fever, fussiness, or possible vaccine reaction on those days.
